alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:18AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Randolph, southeastern Lewis, southeastern Braxton, southern Upshur and northeastern Webster Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 218 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Sutton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holly River State Park, Rock Cave, Flatwoods, Alexander, Eden, Helvetia, Cleveland, Pickens, Alton, Heaters, Hacker Valley, Kanawha Head, Ireland, Centralia and Falls Mills. This includes Interstate 79 between mile markers 67 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Upshur
